byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER, NIKITA STEWART and MIREYA NAVARRO

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration addresses homelessness crisis, problem de Blasio previously downplayed; issue requires de Blasio to balance his liberal beliefs with active approach to problem that concerns many, as evidenced by newspaper headlines and polling numbers;  de Blasio faces crucial decision of replacing Deputy Mayor Lliam Barrios-Paoli, who was charged with overseeing issue and is leaving in September.
lead_paragraph: The resignation of Deputy Mayor Lilliam Barrios-Paoli came amid a scramble by Mayor Bill de Blasio’s team to solve a persistent problem.

headline.main: After Playing Down a Homeless Crisis, Mayor de Blasio Changes His Tone
headline.print_headline: After Playing Down Homeless Crisis, de Blasio Changes His Tone
